name: Diagonal Shoulder Press
how_to_perform:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a weight or dumbbell in each hand.
2. Bend your knees slightly and lean forward at the hips, keeping your back straight.
3. Allow the weights to hang straight down from your hands, with your palms facing each other.
4. Press one weight away from you diagonally across your body, extending your arm fully while keeping the other arm straight and the weight close to your side.
5. Hold for a brief moment, feeling the contraction in your shoulder muscles.
6. Slowly lower the first weight back down to the starting position.
7. Repeat with the opposite arm, pressing the second weight away from you diagonally across your body.
8. Continue alternating arms until you complete the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: The diagonal shoulder press is an upper body exercise that primarily works the deltoids and triceps and can be performed while holding dumbbells.
